required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Investigate the Antihypertensive Efficacy of MK0954
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled Clinical Study to Evaluate the Antihypertensive Efficacy and Safety of Losartan (MK954, DuP753) in Patients With Mild to

brief_summary.textblock: After a 4 week placebo period, patients were randomized to Placebo or Losartan 50 mg arms, after 6 weeks non-responders were up titrated to 100 mg losartan for the remaining 6 weeks. This study evaluated if losartan is more effective than placebo in lowering sitting diastolic blood pressure and is well tolerated in patients with mild to moderate hypertension.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Trough Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 12
primary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and at 12 weeks (24 hours post dose)

secondary_outcome.measure: Categories of Hypertensive Response in Trough Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 6
Categories of Hypertensive Response in Trough Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 12
Mean Change From Baseline in Trough Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 6
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and at 6 weeks (24 hours post dose)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Peak Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 6
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and at 6 weeks (24 hours post dose)

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline in Peak Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 12
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At baseline and at 12 weeks (6 hours post dose)

arm_group.description: Losartan 50 mg titrated to 100 mg after 6 weeks

intervention.description: 50 mg Losartan (MK0954) tablet taken once daily for 12 weeks.
50 mg tablet of Losartan (MK0954) taken once daily for 6 weeks, Non-responders will then have the dose up titrated to 100 mg for remaining 6 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient has been diagnosed with mild to moderate hypertension (SDBP 95-115 mm Hg)
- Patient has no medical problems or treatments that might effect their blood pressure
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant or lactating females
- Patient has secondary hypertension or malignant hypertension
- Sitting systolic blood pressure > 210 mm Hg
- History of stroke
- History of myocardial infarction with in past year
- Current or prior history of heart failure
- Known hypersensitivity to losartan
- Prior exposure to losartan
- Patients known to be HIV positive
- Patient is abusing or has abused alcohol or other drugs within the past 4 years

link.description: MedWatch - FDA maintained medical product safety Information
Merck: Patient & Caregiver U.S. Product Web Site

responsible_party.name_title: Executive Vice President, Clinical and Quantitative Sciences

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were recruited at 22 sites in the United States. Prime Therapy Period: December, 1991 to August, 1992.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients could be randomized after the 4-week placebo baseline period if their mean sitting diastolic blood pressure (SiDBP) was 95-115 mm Hg and ≤7 mm Hg from the mean SiDBP after 2 weeks of placebo therapy

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Losartan placebo orally once daily for 12 weeks

group.title: Losartan 50 mg
group.description: Losartan 50 mg orally once daily for 12 weeks

group.title: Losartan 50/100 mg
group.description: Losartan orally once daily for 12 weeks, initiated as 50 mg and titrated to 100 mg for nonresponders (SiDBP ≥90 mm Hg) after 6 weeks

outcome.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Trough Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 12
outcome.description: Mean change from baseline in trough (24 hours post dose) SiDBP at Week 12
outcome.time_frame: At baseline and at 12 weeks (24 hours post dose)
outcome.population: The primary analysis employed an "all patients treated" approach that included patients with at least one treatment period measurement. The last measurements of withdrawn patients were carried forward to subsequent timepoints. Missing data were estimated by carrying forward data from the last visit (excluding baseline) at which it was available.

measure.title: Mean Change From Baseline in Trough Sitting Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 12
measure.description: Mean change from baseline in trough (24 hours post dose) SiDBP at Week 12
measure.population: The primary analysis employed an "all patients treated" approach that included patients with at least one treatment period measurement. The last measurements of withdrawn patients were carried forward to subsequent timepoints. Missing data were estimated by carrying forward data from the last visit (excluding baseline) at which it was available.

outcome.title: Categories of Hypertensive Response in Trough Diastolic Blood Pressure (SiDBP) at Week 6
outcome.description: Patients with trough SiDBP <90 mm Hg were in Category I, ≥90 but decreased at least 10 mm Hg were in Category II, and ≥90 and decreased less than 10 mm Hg were in Category III.
outcome.population: An "all patients treated" approach was employed that included patients with at least one treatment period measurement. The last measurements of withdrawn patients were carried forward to subsequent timepoints. Missing data were estimated by carrying forward data from the last visit (excluding baseline) at which it was available.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Safety has been reported in the literature.
